Medicare. U.S. citizens and lawful permanent residents who are 65 or older
have a disability or End-Stage Renal Disease and meet certain conditions
for Medicare. If you are already getting Social Security checks
is automatic. If you are not getting Social Security checks

Social Security is also responsible for determining who has to pay an extra amount
for their Part D drug coverage because they have a higher income. If you got a letter
from Social Security telling you that you have to pay the extra amount and have
questions about the amount or if your income went down because of a life-changing
event
column2: you can call Social Security to ask for reconsideration.
